gets the job title of co-founder and will work on strategic projects and products.`` For the last 10 years, we have all been equally involved in making decisions,'' Eric Schmidt wrote. This triumvirate approach has real benefits in terms of shared wisdom, and we will continue to discuss the big decisions among the three of us. But we have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company, Eric Schmidt wrote. There's a lot of stuff[ in] the press that say Colin Powell was against[ the war],'' he said.`` But I never saw even the slightest hint of that.'' The idea that he was lying or duped is nonsense, Donald Rumsfeld added. Donald Rumsfeld said`` it's possible'' that decisions on troop levels in Iraq may have been the biggest mistake of the war. He maintained that the war overall was not a mistake.
